doc.after: Nairobi /naÉªËroÊbÉª/ founded in 1899 as a railway depot for the East African Railway has grown to become one of Africa's largest cities over the past century. It is the capital and largest city of Kenya. The name Nairobi comes from the Maasai phrase Enkare Nyorobi, which translates to "the place of cool waters". However, it is popularly known as the "Green City in the Sun" or by locals as "Nai". Nairobi is the seat of Nairobi County. The city lies on the Nairobi River, in the south of the nation, and has an elevation of 1661 m (5450 ft) above sea-level.
